div.l: By god thoughte he al I have mysgoon̄
Myn̄ heed is toty of my swynke to nyght
That maketh me / that I go nought aright
I wote wel by the cradel / I have mysgo
He lyth the Meller / and his wyf also
And forth he goth / a twenty devel way
Vnto the bed ther / as the Meller lay
He wende have cropen in by his felawe Iohn
And by the Meller / in he crepe anon̄
And caughte hym by the nekke / and softe spake
And seide thou Iohn / thou swyneshed awake
For cristes soule and here a noble game
For by that lorde / that called is seynt Iame
As I have thries in this shorte nyght
Swyued the mellers doughter / thries bolt vpright
While thou has as a Coward ben agast
Ȝe false harlot quood the Meller hast
A fals traytoᵘurr / fals clerk quod he
Thou shalt be ded by goddes dignyte
Who durste be so bolde to disparagedispargedisparage
My doughter / that is comen of swiche lynage
And by the throte bolle / he caught Aleyn̄
And hente hym dispitousely ageyn̄
And on the nose / he smote hym with his fist
Doun ran the blody streme vpon his brist
And in the flore wᵗith nose and mouthe to broke
They walwe as done / two pigges in a poke
And they gon̄ and doıı̄un ageyn̄ anon̄
Till that the Meller sporned at a ston̄
And doıı̄un he fil bakward vpon his wyf
That wyste no thynge / of this nyce stryf
For she was falle a slepe / a lytel wight
With Iohn the Clerk that waked hadde al nyght
And were fal out / of hir slepe she brayde
Helpe holy Cros of bromholme she sayde
In manus tuas lorde to the I calle
Awake Symond the fende is on me falle
Myn herte is broken holpe I nam but deed
